skeletonlisp

    • Constructor Detail

      • Evaluator

        public Evaluator(java.lang.Runnable _exit)
        The constructor for Evaluator requires an instance of Runnable, for the "exit"-primitive.

        It creates the globalEnvironment and initializes it to an empty environment, and also initializes the default exit method

        Parameters:
        _exit - holds the exit method.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public LExp eval(LExp exp)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        The method Eval() is used to evaluate all L-expressions (SkeletonLisp-expressions).

        LValues are returned as they are: they need not be evaluated further

        LIDs are first LOOKed UP IN the globalEnvironment and the bound value is returned: if the Id is not found in theglobalEnvironment, it is LOOKed UP in PRIMITIVE list (primitiveApplier's lookupPrimitive()) and if not found there either, an exception is raised, otherwise the id itself is returned.

        Lambdas are evaluated and returned as they are.

        LApplications are applied with the apply()-method.

        LConds are evaluated with the evalCond()-method.

        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        returns the value of exp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception is thrown if, for any reason, exp cannot be evaluated.

      • evalParamVals

        public java.util.ArrayList<LExp> evalParamVals(java.util.ArrayList<LExp> params)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        evalParams is used to evaluate the parameters of an application when necessary.

        There are a few primitives (AND and OR) that are Special Forms, and require their parameters to not be evaluated beforehand. Otherwise, with any other primitive, or with a lambda, a cond, or another application as the procedure part of an application, the parameter values are always evaluated before they are applied to the procedure. Therefore, SkeletonLisp has a (mostly) strictly eager evaluation process.

        Parameters:
        params - the ArrayList of all the parameters of the application
        Returns:
        returns a new ArrayList with all the evaluated values of parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if one (or more) parameters cannot be evaluated, for some reason.

      • evalCond

        private LExp evalCond(LCond condExp)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        The method evalCond() evaluates LCond-expressions. It evaluates every predicate of each of its' CondCases until one of them returns a value differing from NIL. When such value is found, the result of that particular CondCase is evaluated and returned as the result of the evaluation of the original LCond expression.

        Parameters:
        condExp - the LCond expression to be evaluated
        Returns:
        returns the first result of condExp's CondCases evaluated, whose predicate-part differs from NIL.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if either one of the predicates, or a result cannot be evaluated, or no predicate with a value differing from NIL is found.

      • apply

        private LExp apply(LExp procedure,
         java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVals)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        The method apply is used to evaluate applications.

        Lambda procedures are evaluated by first evaluating all the parameter values, and then using the method applyLambda().

        Cond procedures are applied once again using apply() with the procedure substituted by the result of evaluating the Cond-procedure.

        Applications are applied once again using apply() with the procedure substituted by the result of evaluating the application-procedure.

        LIds are looked up in the globalEnvironment, and if found there, applied once again using apply() with the procedure substituted by the binding of the ID in the globalEnvironment.

        Parameters:
        procedure - the procedure of the application to be evaluated.
        paramVals - the parameter values used with the procedure application.
        Returns:
        returns the result of applying paramVals to procedure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if either the procedure is not a proper procedure, or either at least one of the paramVals cannot be evaluated, or applying the procedure to the paramVals throws an Exception.

      • applyLambda

        private LExp applyLambda(Lambda procedure,
               java.util.ArrayList<LExp> evaledVals)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        the method applyLambda() is used to evaluate the result of a Lambda-procedure.

        applyLambda expects its parameterValues to be evaluated before applyLambda() is called. In order to be able to evaluate the lambda body, it must be transformed into a new LExp by substituting all the lambda Variables that occur FREE in the lambda body, by the evaluated parameter values given to applyLambda().

        Afterwards, the result of evaluating the transformed body is returned.

        A variable occurs free inside a body whenever it is not bound in the body. A variable is bound in the body, if it belongs inside a lambda-expression within the body with one of the the lambda expression's variables matching in its String representation the original variable:

        The first x in the body of (lambda (x y) (or x ((lambda (x) (not x)) y))) is therefore free, but the second x is not free; the variable x in "(lambda (x) ..." binds it.

        Parameters:
        procedure - the Lambda-procedure that is to be applied.
        evaledVals - the evaluated parameter values of the Lambda application.
        Returns:
        returns the result of evaluating the lambda body after substituting all the FREE occuring lambda-variables within the body, with the corresponding parameter values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if the application is used with wrong number of parameter values, or if the body cannot be evaluated for some reason.

      • transformLambdaBody

        private LExp transformLambdaBody(LExp body,
                       java.util.ArrayList<LId> vars,
                       java.util.ArrayList<LExp> vals)
        the method transformLambdaBody is used to substitute all the necessary free variables, within a lambda body, with their corresponding parameter values. The transformation process depends completely on the type of the body:

        If the body is an ID, it is substituted if and only if it is the same ID as any of the variables that are to be substituted.

        if the body is a lambda, first all the original variables that match any of the variables of the body are removed from the list, along with the corresponding parameter values, and only then all the variables that are left in the list, are substituted within the body of the new lambda-expression to their corresponding parameter values

        if the body is an application, both the procedure part and all the application's parameters are transformed by the same rules using transformLambdaBody() with each, and afterwards a new application with the necessary substitutions made, is returned as a result.

        if the body is a Cond-expression every single CondCase is transformed, and a new LCond consisting of the transformed CondCases, is returned as the result.

        in any other case, the original body is returned as-is.

        Parameters:
        body -
        vars -
        vals -
        Returns:

      • applyPrimitive

        private LExp applyPrimitive(LId procedure,
                  java.util.ArrayList<LExp> paramVals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The method applyPrimitive() evaluates the result of a primitive-procedure application with the given parameters. With all other primitives, but EXIT, AND and OR, it first evaluates all the parameterValues using the method evalParamVals(), and then calls the approppriate PrimitiveApplier-method with the evaluated parameter values. In the case of EXIT, applyPrimitive just calls the Runnable exit's run() method and then returns a farewell LString as it's value.

        With AND and OR, the parameter values are given as-is, to the approppriate PrimitiveApplier-methods.

        Parameters:
        procedure - the procedure of an application.
        paramVals - ArrayList of the parameter values to be applied to procedure.
        Returns:
        returns a new LExp as a result of applying the given parameter Values to the given procedure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception is thrown if the application cannot be evaluated, for some reason.

      • lookupIdInGlobalEnv

        private LExp lookupIdInGlobalEnv(LId id)
        the method lookupIdInGlobalEnvironment is used to look up the binding of an LId in globalEnvironment

        Parameters:
        id - an LId whose binding is to be returned
        Returns:
        returns the binding of id in globalEnvironment. If there is no binding for id, null is returned.
